dissolve.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if a solid dissolves, or if you dissolve it, it mixes with a liquid and becomes part of it
dissolve.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to formally end a parliament, business arrangement, marriage etc
dissolve.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The monarch had the power to dissolve parliament.
dissolve.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to gradually become smaller or weaker before disappearing, or to make something do this
dissolve.translation[0].definitions[2].e: A few clouds formed briefly before dissolving again.
dissolve.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to bring a company or PARTNERSHIP to an end officially
dissolve.translation[1].definitions[0].e: He announced that he was dissolving the company because of financial problems.
